result.execSummary:
All charges against Stacey L. Shepherd in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stacey L. Shepherd is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacey L. Shepherd

records.addlTxt: Motion to Dismiss- Shepherd, Stacey L.pdf
Order for Dismissal_1 - Shepherd, Stacey L.docx

2:31 PM 
Defendant Stacey L. Shepherd in court.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is informed once again she has the right to retain counsel.
Defendant does NOT qualify for court appointment of counsel.
Court finds defendant has waived her right to counsel for preliminary hearing today due to lack of retaining counsel.

State calls Corporal Ryan Redfearn to the stand.
**Ryan Redfearn is affirmed.
Direct examination by the State.
Defendant Stacey Shepherd askes the witness a question.
Redirect by DA Gill.

State files information.
Information is printed and provided to the defendant.

Court finds probable cause and orders defendant be bound over for arraignment.

State files informs.
Defendant is provided with a copy.

Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 03:20 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:31 PM - Megan Schultz reported from the DAR in Green County
 Attorney Jenna L Gill appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Prosecuting Atty Jenna L Gill appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Stacey L. Shepherd appeared by phone means.
Court gives defendant her rights.
Defendant is informed that if she fails to retain counsel by the her next court date the hearing will go on and if she fails to retain counsel by then court will consider it a waiver.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

 Defendant Stacey L. Shepherd in court. Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.

01:27  PM
Defendant Stacey L. Shepherd in court. Prosecuting Atty Jenna L Gill appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint.
Court verbally reviews charges/penalties for the record.
Court finds probable cause for filing.
Court informs the defendant of her right to counsel.
Defendant is provided with PD phone number and petition for court appointed counsel. 

Court Orders:
$5,000.00 Signature Bond
-No contact with victim 1 her residence or place of employment.

Defendant files her State v. Dean form with the court.
Defendant is affirmed and testifies.
Court questions defendant re: Financials

Court finds: Defendant does not qualify for court appointed counsel.

Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Victim 1 her residence or place of employment.
